page.title: 14Transport
page.content: The area is crossed by two main traffic systems. There is the main railway link between the cities of Birmingham and Leicester and a motorway.There was once a station at Croft but this was burnt down some time ago.There is a siding for a rail link with the quarry at Croft.There is a disused railway link between Stoney Stanton and the main line that once served the now disused quarries there.There is the main motor way link between Leicester and Coventry the M69.The other major roadway is the Fosse Way . This used to take the bulk of the traffic between Coventry and Leicester, but is now relatively quiet and is no longer regarded as a trunkroad the A46. It has been reclassified as a "B" road.
